name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies that are perfect for any occasion. This family recipe has been passed down for generations.
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy.

3. Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla.

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.

5. Gradually mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients.

6. Stir in chocolate chips.

7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.

8. Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown.

9. Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
description: A fresh and healthy quinoa salad packed with Mediterranean flavors. Perfect for meal prep or as a light lunch.
instructions:
1. Rinse quinoa under cold water until water runs clear.

2. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups water to boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.

3. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and let cool.

4. Meanwhile, dice cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion.

5. Crumble feta cheese and roughly chop olives.

6. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.

7. In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, vegetables, feta, and olives.

8. Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.

9. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

name: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken
description: An authentic Thai stir-fry with ground chicken, Thai basil, and chilies. Served over jasmine rice for a complete meal.
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.

2. Add garlic and chilies, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.

3. Add ground chicken and cook, breaking it up, until no longer pink (about 3-4 minutes).

4. Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir to combine.

5. Add green beans and cook for 2-3 minutes until tender-crisp.

6. Remove from heat and stir in Thai basil leaves until wilted.

7. Serve immediately over jasmine rice.

8. Garnish with additional basil leaves and sliced chilies if desired.

name: Homemade Sourdough Bread
description: Artisanal sourdough bread with a crispy crust and tangy flavor. Requires a sourdough starter but worth the effort!
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix sourdough starter with water until well combined.

2. Add flour and salt, mix until a shaggy dough forms.

3. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes (autolyse).

4. Perform 4 sets of stretch and folds, 30 minutes apart.

5. Cover and bulk ferment for 4-6 hours at room temperature.

6. Pre-shape the dough and let rest 20 minutes.

7. Final shape and place in banneton, seam-side up.

8. Refrigerate overnight (12-48 hours).

9. Preheat Dutch oven to 475°F (245°C).

10. Score the dough and bake covered for 20 minutes.

11. Remove lid and bake 20-25 minutes until golden brown.

12. Cool completely before slicing.

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: Rich and creamy risotto with mixed mushrooms and Parmesan cheese. A comforting Italian classic that's perfect for dinner.
instructions:
1. Heat chicken stock in a saucepan and keep warm.

2. In a large skillet, sauté mushrooms with 1 tbsp butter until golden. Season and set aside.

3. In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat remaining butter and olive oil.

4. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.

5. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.

6. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes until edges are translucent.

7. Add wine and stir until absorbed.

8. Add warm stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.

9. Continue until rice is creamy and al dente (about 18-20 minutes).

10. Stir in mushrooms, Parmesan, and herbs.

11. Season to taste and serve immediately.
